conclusion: Determine which light beam is more likely to exhibit diffraction.
Light beams a and b are incident perpendicular to the flat surface AB of the glass brick.
Both beams refract at point C on the flat surface.
Beam b bends more than beam a after refraction, indicating beam b has a higher refractive index.
Refractive index n is the ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in the medium.
Refractive index n is related to the wavelength λ of light in the medium by n = λ0/λ.
Beam b has a shorter wavelength in the glass brick compared to beam a.
Diffraction is more pronounced for longer wavelengths.
Beam a, with the longer wavelength, is more likely to exhibit diffraction effects.
The statement that light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light a is incorrect.
